title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: Jerome Powell doubles down on a word that has haunted him, saying pain from tariffs would be ‘transitory’
items.description: The Fed’s slowness to catch the inflation surge that began during the pandemic has earned it scads of criticism. Is this time different?

items.title: Texas Senate passes two bills that would bring mandatory prayer time and the Ten Commandments into classrooms
items.description: Bill now goes to House of Representatives.

items.title: Netflix is making a Willy Wonka reality/competition show
Trump wants to kill tax on tips. That could save Americans over $100 billion over the next decade—but experts warn it’ll make tipping culture so much worse
items.description: Waiters, valets, and baristas: Think you'll be better off now that Trump wants to kill tax on tips? Think again.

items.title: Americans finally got a rule protecting their credit scores from unexpected medical debt. Now Trump is attacking the agency behind it
items.description: The policy to remove health-care bills from credit reporting must remain to protect patients from predatory billing practices.

items.title: Robinhood now allows March Madness bets. Will other brokerages follow?
Nvidia's CEO praised this Trump policy. And the stock is bouncing.
‘Death cross’ is back in play — not just for Nvidia but also the Russell 2000
Tesla has a big Elon Musk problem, and Wall Street’s biggest bull is not happy
Federal-funds futures market still signaling hope for three Fed rate cuts in ’25
